user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_fini:
```c
void
MHD_fini (void)
{
#ifdef HTTPS_SUPPORT
  gnutls_global_deinit ();
#endif /* HTTPS_SUPPORT */
#if defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  WSACleanup ();
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
  MHD_monotonic_sec_counter_finish ();
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  WSACleanup ();
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the fragment calls the WinSock API function WSACleanup(), not MHD_fini. There is no direct self-call and no reasonable indication of an indirect call back to MHD_fini, so no recursion is introduced. (Only if WSACleanup were somehow implemented to call MHD_fini would Rule 17.2 be violated.)
